Merge with doubling

One orthographic rule of Egyptian/Sumerian seems to be stretched vowels via duplication:
𓎡 𓏏 𓎡 𓏏 𓀁 quiet
𓎡 𓎛 𓎡 𓎛 𓀗 ghiero : gero γέρων Greis

𓃀 𓂝 𓃀 𓂝 𓀢||drink|bebe bibo@Lat
𓃀 𓂝 𓃀 𓂝 𓈗||drink|boire

𓇋 𓄿 𓄿 𓏏 𓇣||rod, reeds, rushes| yair't

𒂼𒂼 AMA-AMA = OMA (grand mother)!

  1. 𒀜𒈬 𒀜𒀜𒈬 𒂼𒈬 𒂼𒂼𒈬 𒋀𒈬 𒊩𒈠𒈬
  2. AD.MU AD-AD.MU AMA.MU AMA-AMA.MU ŠEŠ.MU NIN.MU
  3. vata-my vatta-my mama-mia oma-my sistor-my niña-my
  4. my father, my grandfather, my mother, my grandmother, my brother, my sister,

Maybe we also witness consonant clusters/clarification: GG⋍NG/GN
